com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FGroupedDataView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FGroupedDataView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener

    public class FGroupedDataView
extends FContainer
    Component to visualize grouped table like data, possibly employing lazy calls.
    Author:
    cp

    • Constructor Detail

      • FGroupedDataView

        public FGroupedDataView(java.lang.String id,
                com.fluidops.ajax.components.groupeddataview.GroupedDataModel<?> data,
                boolean skiptoplevel,
                FGroupedDataView.EditMode editMode,
                boolean transactionalEditing,
                boolean startInEditMode,
                boolean dynamicEditModeUI,
                java.lang.String htmlIfEmpty,
                java.lang.String contextPath)
        Constructs the view.
        Parameters:
        id - FComponent identifier
        data - Data to render contents; the view supports data models with up to four levels in depth.
        skiptoplevel - Whether to skip the most significant top level (top groups as sections) of the view hierarchy. If you choose to do so, all data render as one grouped list. Note, that this also reduces the maximum tree depth to 3.
        editMode - Decides whether the component is read only, or could be put in edit mode either at once as a whole or per section (or both combined ad lib of the user).
        transactionalEditing - Assumes not read-only. If set true, edit fields will open up immediately when put into edit mode but changes will affect the data model only after the user clicks "save changes". The same holds for adding and deleting values. In addition, changes will be stored on a transactional ("all or none") basis through a call to GroupedDataModel.txCommit(java.util.Collection) as GroupedDataModel.nonTxChangeKey(Object) and associated add/delete methods won't be called for any of the changes. If set false, values can be edited and stored, added or deleted on a non-transactional per-value basis.
        startInEditMode - Starts widget in edit mode (assumes that editMode is not READ_ONLY)
        dynamicEditModeUI - Determines whether the UI in edit mode should act in a dynamic, responsive fashion. When turned on, edit field availability switches automatically in a dynamic fashion. Otherwise, input fields only become available for editing after an explicit additional click.
        htmlIfEmpty - HTML code to render in place of the data in case if the data model is empty.
        contextPath - Context path where to look up additional resources such as images and the like. s

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public java.lang.String render()
        Description copied from class: FContainer
        draw the HTML anchors of the kids - populate view will be triggered from the page since the components are all registered. The specific implementation should override this method since it only providers a very basic layout
        Overrides:
        render in class FContainer
        Returns:

      • editNewSection

        public void editNewSection(com.fluidops.ajax.components.groupeddataview.GroupedDataModel<?> data)
        Supports external addition of new sections while editing. Adds a new section with any number of contained groups in edit mode, avoids a full refresh of the component. Also puts all groups within the new section into edit mode immediately.
        Parameters:
        data - Data node associated with the section to edit.

      • reportMethodUpdate

        public static FClientUpdate reportMethodUpdate(java.lang.String htmlId,
                               java.lang.String eventName,
                               int xPathDistance,
                               boolean eventBubbling)
        Creates a FClientUpdate to add a Java Script event reporting method to the specified inner field. Reporting methods trigger a specific collector method up in the XPath at the surrounding MonitoredValueCell (or any other parent FComponent exposing a compatible client-side collector method).
        Parameters:
        htmlId - ID of HTML element to address.
        eventName - Event to report, e.g., MouseOver
        xPathDistance - XPath distance measured from the reporting EditFieldComponent or ViewFieldComponent.
        eventBubbling - Whether or not the added event listener should request JS event bubbling.
        Returns:
        New FClientUpdate

      • reportMethodUpdate

        public static FClientUpdate reportMethodUpdate(java.lang.String htmlId,
                               boolean mouseOver)
        Convenience method to call #reportMethodUpdate(String, boolean, int) with default events and distance for required MonitoredValueCell reporting.
        Parameters:
        htmlId - As in #reportMethodUpdate(String, boolean, int).
        mouseOver - Is this a MouseOver event? (otherwise MouseOut)
        Returns:
        As in #reportMethodUpdate(String, String, int).

      • setGlobalEditModeCallback

        public void setGlobalEditModeCallback(FEventListener callback)
        Sets an event handler to react on a click on the global edit button. The callback will NOT be triggered, if any individual group of entries is being put into edit mode in GROUPWISE or COMBINED editing.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • setGlobalViewModeCallback

        public void setGlobalViewModeCallback(FEventListener callback)
        Sets an event handler to react on a click on the global Save/Cancel/End Editing buttons. The callback will NOT be triggered, if any individual group of entries is being/closed put into view mode in GROUPWISE or COMBINED editing.
        Parameters:
        callback -
